content.title: Assistance for Tools, Equipment, Shorting/Grading Equipment, PHM Equipment for Scheduled Tribes (HRT-3)
content.department: Directorate of Horticulture, Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat
content.beneficiary: Farmers belonging to the Scheduled Tribes category, farmer groups, and cooperative societies
content.details: The scheme 'Assistance for Tools, Equipment, Shorting/Grading Equipment, PHM Equipment for Scheduled Tribes (HRT-3)' provides financial assistance to farmers and groups for purchasing various tools and equipment, including sorting/grading and Post-Harvest Management (PHM) equipment.
benefits: Scheduled Tribes farmers are eligible for assistance up to 75% of the cost of the Tools/Equipment or ₹3,750/-, whichever is less.

Farmer groups/cooperative societies are eligible for assistance of 90% of the cost of equipment or up to ₹7,50,000/-, whichever is less, for the installation of Post-Harvest Management (PHM) Equipment.
eligibility: The beneficiary should be a permanent resident of Gujarat.
The beneficiary should belong to the Scheduled Tribes.
Individual farmers or farmer groups/Cooperative Societies are eligible to avail benefits under the scheme.
content.application_process: Online application through the I-Khedut Portal.
documents_required: Scheduled Tribes Certificate issued by competent authority
Disability Certificate issued by Competent Authority (only for PWDs) (if applicable)
Copy of forest rights Letter (if applicable)

faqs.question: Who is eligible to benefit from the scheme?
faqs.answer: Permanent residents of Gujarat belonging to the Scheduled Tribes category, as well as individual farmers and farmer groups/cooperative societies, are eligible to avail benefits under the scheme.

faqs.question: What financial assistance is available for Scheduled Tribes farmers under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Scheduled Tribes farmers are eligible for assistance up to 75% of the cost of the tools/equipment or ₹3,750/-, whichever is less.

faqs.question: What assistance is available for farmer groups/cooperative societies under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Farmer groups/cooperative societies are eligible for assistance of 90% of the cost of equipment or up to ₹7,50,000/-, whichever is less, for the installation of Post-Harvest Management (PHM) Equipment.

faqs.question: What types of equipment are covered under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme covers various tools, equipment, sorting/grading equipment, and Post-Harvest Management (PHM) equipment, including plastic crates with equipment such as weights, packing materials, sorting/grading machinery, etc.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for beneficiaries under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries must be permanent residents of Gujarat and belong to the Scheduled Tribes category.

faqs.question: Can farmer groups and cooperative societies avail benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, farmer groups and cooperative societies are eligible to avail benefits under the scheme along with individual farmers.

faqs.question: Are there any specific purchasing guidelines for the tools/equipment under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The tools/equipment must be purchased from authorized dealers of empanelled manufacturers to ensure price discovery as notified by the Department of Agriculture.

faqs.question: How can one apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants can apply online through the I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/

faqs.question: Can applicants track their application status online?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants can check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the link: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx
